title: Logical Access Controls
description: The entity implements logical access security measures to protect assets from unauthorized access. This includes password policies, multi-factor authentication, and role-based access controls.

title: Access Credentials Management
description: The entity creates and maintains access credentials for authorized users. Credentials are assigned based on job responsibilities and reviewed regularly for appropriateness.

title: Access Removal
description: The entity removes access credentials when access is no longer required. This includes immediate removal upon termination and periodic review of active credentials.

title: Logical Access Security
description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events.

title: Data Classification
description: The entity disposes of information, software, and hardware to meet the entity's objectives related to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy.

title: Encryption and Key Management
description: The entity encrypts data at rest and in transit using industry-standard encryption algorithms. Encryption keys are managed securely with proper rotation policies.

title: Network Security
description: The entity implements network security controls to protect against unauthorized access, including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and network segmentation.

title: Principles of Data Processing
description: Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject. Data shall be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes.

title: Lawfulness of Processing
description: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that at least one of the following applies: consent, contract, legal obligation, vital interests, public task, or legitimate interests.

title: Conditions for Consent
description: Where processing is based on consent, the controller shall be able to demonstrate that the data subject has consented to processing of his or her personal data.

title: Consent for Children
description: Where processing is based on consent, the controller shall be able to demonstrate that the data subject has consented to processing of his or her personal data.

title: Processing of Special Categories
description: Processing of personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, or trade union membership is prohibited.

title: Information to be Provided
description: The controller shall provide the data subject with information including identity of controller, purposes of processing, legal basis, and data subject rights.

title: Right of Access
description: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning him or her are being processed.

title: Right to Erasure
description: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller the erasure of personal data without undue delay where certain conditions are met.

title: Data Protection by Design
description: The controller shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure data protection principles are embedded into processing activities.

title: Security of Processing
description: The controller shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including encryption and pseudonymization.

title: Notification of Breach
description: In the case of a personal data breach, the controller shall without undue delay and, where feasible, not later than 72 hours after having become aware of it, notify the supervisory authority.

title: Data Protection Impact Assessment
description: Where processing is likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller shall carry out a data protection impact assessment.

title: Administrative Safeguards
description: Implement policies and procedures to prevent, detect, contain, and correct security violations. This includes security officer designation, workforce training, and access management.

title: Technical Safeguards
description: Implement technical policies and procedures for electronic information systems to allow access only to authorized persons and software programs.

title: Organizational Requirements
description: Ensure that business associate contracts include provisions to ensure that the business associate will appropriately safeguard protected health information.

title: Protect Stored Cardholder Data
description: Do not store sensitive authentication data after authorization. Render primary account numbers unreadable anywhere they are stored using strong cryptography.

title: Render PAN Unreadable
description: Render primary account numbers unreadable anywhere they are stored, including portable digital media, backup media, and in logs.

title: Encrypt Transmission of Cardholder Data
description: Use strong cryptography and security protocols to safeguard sensitive cardholder data during transmission over open, public networks.

title: Restrict Access to Cardholder Data
description: Limit access to cardholder data by business need-to-know. Assign access based on job classification and function.

title: Identify and Authenticate Access
description: Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access. Implement proper user identification and authentication mechanisms.

title: Track and Monitor Access
description: Implement audit trails to link all access to system components to each individual user. Log all access to cardholder data.

title: Access Control Policy
description: Establish and maintain access control policies and procedures to ensure that users have appropriate access to information systems and data.

title: User Access Management
description: Implement user registration and de-registration procedures. Manage user access rights and review access regularly.

title: Password Management
description: Implement secure password management systems and procedures to ensure passwords are strong, stored securely, and changed regularly.

title: Cryptographic Controls
description: Implement cryptographic controls to protect the confidentiality, authenticity and/or integrity of information in accordance with risk assessment.

title: Operational Procedures
description: Document operating procedures and ensure they are made available to all users who need them. Changes to systems shall be controlled.

title: Malware Protection
description: Implement malware protection mechanisms to detect, prevent, and recover from malicious code attacks.

title: Network Security Management
description: Manage network security to protect information in networks and protect the supporting network infrastructure from unauthorized access.

title: Secure Development
description: Establish secure development procedures to ensure that security is built into information systems throughout the software development lifecycle.

title: Code Review Requirements
description: All code changes must be reviewed by at least one other developer before merging to main branch. Reviews must check for security vulnerabilities.

title: Dependency Scanning
description: All dependencies must be scanned for known vulnerabilities before deployment. Outdated or vulnerable dependencies must be updated or replaced.

title: Secret Management
description: No hardcoded secrets, API keys, or credentials in source code. All secrets must be stored in secure vaults and accessed via environment variables.

title: Infrastructure as Code
description: All infrastructure must be defined as code and version controlled. Manual infrastructure changes are prohibited.

title: Automated Testing
description: All code must have automated tests with minimum 80% code coverage. Security tests must be included in the test suite.

title: Incident Response
description: Security incidents must be reported within 1 hour of discovery. Incident response procedures must be documented and tested quarterly.

title: Backup and Recovery
description: All critical data must be backed up daily. Backup restoration procedures must be tested at least quarterly.

title: Monitoring and Alerting
description: All production systems must have comprehensive monitoring and alerting. Critical alerts must be responded to within 15 minutes.
